If that happens, I think SEDG will get back to a triple digit share price as it becomes profitable again.The company is cutting expenses while selling off excess inventory, which will help future profit margins once there's no longer an over-supply of inventory that SEDG needs to sell before bringing in new supply. Demand for solar will continue to increase rapidly, and I very much doubt Israel would let one of its more important companies go under, so there's powerful support for SEDG long-term. Once SEDG demonstrates that, shares won't be available anywhere near 20, so I'm seizing this moment and opportunity.

So besides really old technicals, what's the argument that now is the right time to buy?According to the earnings call, SEDG's backlog of inventory won't be resolved in the US until Q4, and in Europe until next year, so I think a good starting point for when SEDG could start to show strong numbers would be Q2 of next year, when that issue is winding down/done, seasonality is working in SEDG's favor, and interest rates have fallen.On interest rates, while we probably will see the first rate cut in the US next month, I doubt one will be enough for people to finance rooftop solar in the sort of volume that will drive stellar profits, as residential solar has always been a game of the time frame for return on investment and then how many more years you can get free energy out of it, unless you go with a PPA, which likely is also financed by the owner of the system... If people are anticipating 5 rate cuts in a 12 month period, what would be the rush to install a system on credit that will take a decade or so to pay for itself?And even if you're betting on rate cuts being a driver, why is SEDG positioned better than any number of other stocks, say those associated with home building or heavy machinery to take advantage of them?
